Class Item

The Item class represents a single in-game item eg. a sword and has support for recipes and frame-by-frame actions. The class is not a Monobehaviour but has a virtual function DoOnUpdate that can be called to behave similarly to a Monobehaviour. It is indended to be subclassed and have its methods overridden.

ItemName

The ItemName is the same as the prefab name, but without the .prefab extension. It refers to the item after it has been loaded by Jotunn's ItemManager, basically. ChebGonaz_SkeletonWand

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

CreateConfigs(BaseUnityPlugin)

Create your item's config stuff here. Example of overridden method:

public override void CreateConfigs(BaseUnityPlugin plugin)
{
    base.CreateConfigs(plugin);

    Allowed = plugin.Config.Bind($"{GetType().Name} (Server Synced)", "OrbOfBeckoningAllowed",
        true, new ConfigDescription("Whether crafting an Orb of Beckoning is allowed or not.", null,
            new ConfigurationManagerAttributes { IsAdminOnly = true }));

    CraftingStationRequired = plugin.Config.Bind($"{GetType().Name} (Server Synced)", "OrbOfBeckoningCraftingStation",
        CraftingTable.Workbench, new ConfigDescription("Crafting station where it's available", null,
            new ConfigurationManagerAttributes { IsAdminOnly = true }));

Declaration
public virtual void CreateConfigs(BaseUnityPlugin plugin)
Parameters
Type Name Description
BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin plugin

GetCustomItemFromPrefab(GameObject)

To be used when loading the item's prefab from an asset bundle. It will generate and return the Jotunn CustomItem object or null on error.

Method SetRecipeReqs sets the material requirements needed to craft the item via a recipe.

| Improve this Doc View Source

UpdateRecipe()

An open ended function for updating a recipe. 

public override void UpdateRecipe()
{
    UpdateRecipe(CraftingStationRequired, CraftingCost, CraftingStationLevel);
}

Declaration
public virtual void UpdateRecipe()
